review.title: Hotel in nice area.
review.reviewText: The air conditioner did not work!  It blew out semi cool air, not cold.  It also ran by a timer we could not control.  It cut off and on as it desired.  I was hot the whole time I was in the room!  Free parking is a joke!  The hotel has like 8-10 compact parking spots for the whole hotel. These are suppose to be 1st come 1st serve.  I actually heard the desk clerk tell a vacationer to come by after 9:00 pm and he would give them a space for cash if there was one available!  So much for free parking!  Oh and please if you have any kind of SUV forget it, you need a compact car for sure! So we ended up parking on the street and getting a ticket.  Trust me just stay at a larger hotel with a parking deck and pay up front for parking..... cheaper than a ticket!  Oh and one more thing, there was no scoop in the Ice bin.  No telling what germs were in there!  Needless to say I will NEVER stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, Air conditioner.  The bed was horrible.  Lumpy and uncomfortable!

managementResponses.response: Dear Jon, we are sorry that you felt that our hotel was average during your recent stay - we aim to provide a clean comfortable hotel, and professional service to all of our guests, and the vast majority have a wonderful time with us. Thank you very much for your review - we appreciate the time you've taken to do so.

review.title: Just avg
review.reviewText: Average hotel, nothing great, small room, very limited parking.

managementResponses.response: Jon, thank you for taking the time to review your stay in our hotel. We hope that you enjoyed your stay with us, despite the apparent difficulties that you had in parking. We are located in highly desirable area in San Francisco, which obviously has many advantages, but one disadvantage is that, whilst we offer complimentary parking for our guests, we have limited space to do so, and there are occasional times that we are unable to accommodate everyone. In such instances, there is street parking available that is very convenient to the hotel. We hope that once you got your parking sorted, that you were able to enjoy your trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Very limited parking
review.reviewText: Small spaces and limited parking, first come first served. Otherwise take your chances on the street.

managementResponses.response: We are really pleased that you had such a good stay with us, and that you enjoyed our location so much. We are known for the friendliness of our staff, so we're happy that they made such a good impression on you too.We hope that you'll be back to stay with us if you return to San Francisco.

review.title: Just what we wanted
review.reviewText:
This hotel was perfect for us. It was reasonably price and the location was good for us. It had off street parking so once we got there we walked, used a taxi, or a tour bus. The staff was helpful and suggested many things to do to make out trip better!
It was not a fancy hotel with amenities but we came to San Francisco to see the city not hang out in our hotel room!!

managementResponses.response: Dear guest, we were pleased to see that you loved the location and easy access to major attractions as well bars and restaurants. This area is highly desirable for travelers. We were a bit disappointed to see that you felt that our hotel is only ideal for a short stay. We always strive to provide a clean, comfortable stay with a top notch service for our guests. And guests generally love the comfortable bed, our amenities and overall cleanliness. Please know that we will look into your experience and make improvements. But we sincerely hope you'll give us another opportunity to restore your confidence in our hotel. Thanks again for your feedback.

review.title: Motel - it's what u pay for in SF money
review.reviewText: You get an OK bed if you just care to spend a night. Otherwise the place could use some upgrades.
review.locationRemarks: Close by the hop on and off bus tour stop and near some nice bars and restaurants in the area. Good location if you want to stay near downtown.

managementResponses.response: Michael, It is good to hear from a returning guest. We are really pleased that you had a wonderful stay with us. We're happy to be an affordable rate for travelers visiting San Francisco who need a clean, comfortable place with a great location. We hope that our great rates, service and amenities will keeps us on your radar for your next visit. Thank you for staying with us and for your wonderful review.

review.title: Second time at this hotel, even better this time
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here in 2012 and thought the room was clean and basic but that's what we were expecting. We loved the proximity to the marina and the fact that it has free wifi, mini fridge, and free parking. This time was even better (2016). We got an updated room with nice laminate flooring and stone countertops, also we had a nice street view of Lombard and was able to open the window for the breeze and background city noise (if ur into that). They offer free breakfast and the little patio is nice to sit on while having coffee with a nice city and water view. It's no Ritz but I love this little hotel..ESPECIALLY for the price, that's why we came back again. üëçüèº

managementResponses.response: HI Steve, we are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and found our hotel to be of a great value. We aim to provide a quality stay at a great price, so we are glad that we achieved our goal on your visit. Once again, thank you for taking time to write us your review, we hope to see you soon again!

review.title: Perfectly fine 2 star hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: If you need to stay in San Fransisco on a budget then this place is perfectly fine. Don't expect too many frills, this is 2 star hotel for sure. However the rooms are clean and the facility kept in good order. The staff were very nice and helpful. Breakfast is a bit of joke, don't rely on it if you have a long day of walking to do around the city.
review.locationRemarks: Cow Hollow has plenty of shops and restaurants, plenty to do within walking distance.

managementResponses.response: Danielle, thank you so much for your stellar review! We're happy your stay with us was pleasant from room to location. Our great location puts guests right in the area they want to be, and we're glad to hear that you enjoyed that benefit. Once again, thank you so much for your wonderful comments, we're looking forward to your next stay with us.

review.title: Nice M/Hotel steps away from the Presidio
review.reviewText: Room was exceptionally clean! Steps away from Presidio and Marina. One block down on Chestnut St are all the restaurants and delis so you can dine to fit your budget. If you're willing to climb the hills of Frisco, you're a 25 min walk to the Painted Ladies and the tour bus stops. 10 min in the car will take you to the Wharf all from a Motel on famed Lombard St. Oh and we are breakfast outside everyday!

managementResponses.response: We're pleased that you enjoyed your stay. There's nothing better than knowing that you've found a safe, clean, and comfortable place to stay after a long flight. That's one less worry on your plate during your travel! Thanks for choosing us. If you're ever in the area again, you're welcome to stay with us!

review.reviewText: Cheap tickets available for Airport Shuttle (we called the hotel upon arrival at airport, and they told us where to find the correct Shuttle).  Hotel location was convenient to where my daughter and I wanted to be.  Front office staff was  friendly and helped carry our luggage upstairs.  They also kept it stored on our check-out day until it was time to take the Shuttle back to the airport in the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty inner courtyard offered private place to unload baggage.
review.negativeRemarks: Add elevator to get to 2nd floor.
review.locationRemarks: Not much in the immediate block or two vicinity, but the marina is not far.

managementResponses.response: Hi there, there seems to be a confusion here. We haven't had a elevator down at all recently, also we do not have a patio. Furthermore, there is no parking in the hotel, the valet parking or self parking is available next to the hotel.

review.reviewText:
No elevator, when your tired from a long day of traveling the last thing you want to do is lug 3-50lbs bags up 2 flights of stairs.
T.V. did not work, they came up 2 days later to fix, but within 24 hours it quit working again.
room was dirty.food or some other substance smeared on the walls. they only gave 1 bath towel, and the towel were worn and torn, and when you want to have a shower at night and 1 in the morning you had to track down
housekeeping in the morning to get another towel. Patio was filthy and unusable. They deleted are access cards before our stay was over. Breakfast, what little they did offer had no place to sit down and eat it, you had to haul 
it to your room. The free parking is limited to ask few spots, and usually none available if you are not back by 6:00pm, then you get to try to find an place to park, good luck with 
that.
This would be able fine overnight hotel for under $75.00 dollars. Not worth going for a long term stay like we had, and paid over $100.00 and night.

managementResponses.response: We really want our customers to have a wonderful stay with us, if they do not, then we are disappointed as well. We are located in highly desirable area with many restaurants and places close by, but we do not usually hear complaints about the noise, I am sorry that this was the case during your visit. We hope you'll give us another try.

review.title: avoid it
review.reviewText: Noisy rooms, dirty; fixtures in the bathroom not functioning properly
review.locationRemarks: located on noisy street, good location, but street is filthy

managementResponses.response: Hi Bob, so sorry about the shower issue, we really want our guests to love their stay, we wish you'd brought this to our attention, we would have sent some one to fix the shower or give you another room to ensure you had a wonderful stay with us. We hope to welcome you back again soon. Thank you, Bob.

review.title: You get what you pay for, it worked for the night!
review.reviewText: It's a little out dated, but the price was right, free parking, free wifi . So the room wasn't bad , I thought alright not bad for $99.00 in till morning when I went to take a shower. You guessed it the shower doesn't work. The bath tub did. No thanks.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Hugo, hope you enjoyed neighborhood clubs, bars and restaurants. We can't wait to welcome you back again soon. Thanks again.

review.title: It nice close to clubs ,bars and restaurants !
review.reviewText: I recommend they have parking internet they nice too I definitely stay there again !!!

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Emma! We're thrilled to hear that you loved all aspects of your stay with us. We hope you'll stay with us again next time you visit the area. Thanks again.

review.title: Cheap room
review.reviewText: Room was clean and tidy, what you would expect for a budget hotel. Staff were happy to help when toilet was blocked, plunger was stored under the sink in bathroom. All in all a good place to stay for a few nights.

managementResponses.response: We are located in highly desirable area; however, we do provide complimentary parking for guests as first come first serve basis. If you need a help parking in our parking lot, please know that we are always willing to help. Thank you.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Very limited and small parking space. Lobby/checking is very small

managementResponses.response: Brye, glad that you loved our room and thank you for your feedback on bathroom cleanliness. Our staff is generally very thorough when it comes to preparing the room for upcoming guests so it is strange that we looked over cleanliness of your bathroom. Please accept our apologies. We hope, you'll give us another try.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location!
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean.  The staff was great upgraded me as soon as I got there.  Room was clean but the bathroom wasn't so great.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great, the price great and the staff was great!
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of the bathroom would be nice....
review.locationRemarks: Great location the Warf and restuarants.  Walk really any where....

managementResponses.response: So sorry that you were disappointed with your stay. The experiences you described here definitely falls short of standards we set for ourselves. Our staff is very thorough and maintains high quality standards in cleanliness and hospitality to ensure our guests have great, quality stay. It is strange that this has happened. If there is any other way we can make your future stays more pleasant, please don‚Äôt hesitate to let us know. Our goal is to make our guests as comfortable as possible and we‚Äôll look forward to having the opportunity to do just that.

review.title: Not very clean
review.reviewText: Bedding was dirty, floors were dirty, shower did not work, although covered parking was advertised it is very limited & had to park on street and pay for meter

managementResponses.response: So sorry that this happened. Please note that we looked into it to ensure this does not happen again. Once again, so sorry about this. We sincerely hope you'll give us another try.

review.reviewText: Heating system not working in the room, hotel staff said wait till 8 am in morning for maintenance guy to fix it. It was cold. Cramped parking lot.

managementResponses.response: Glad we could make your visit comfortable and pleasant. Hope to see you soon again!

review.title: Free parking and breakfast
review.reviewText: Parking is limited but we didn't have any issues getting a spot on the days we decided to drive around the city.

managementResponses.response: Hi there, thank you for staying with us during you recent trip to San Francisco. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We will look into your feedback about the power outlets. Thanks again, we look forward to welcome you back again next time you are in the area.

review.title: Clean motel close to Presidio and Marina
review.reviewText: Overall, the experience was good. It's quiet and the temoerature is perfect. The AC has digital thermostat. We slept very well each night. The wide cable selection is more than enough -- I was glad they had Tennis Channel. TV is digital.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking, reliable free wireless service, helpful staff, free breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: There shiukd be two nightstands, not just one. There should be more power outlets to charge devices. I had to go to the bathroom to charge my iPhone.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. There's a nearby fastfood restaurant (Pluto's) that sells delicious foods (salads, burgers, etc.) that are not expensive.

review.title: Good experience overall
review.reviewText: We had a good experience here. It had everything we wanted: close to major attractions, free parking, breakfast, comfy bed, and heater. Yes it is on a busy street, but it didn't bother us considering how tired we would be at the end of the day. Only complaint is that when we took a shower, the mist revealed some yellowing next to the toilet that most likely was urine! So I definitely recommend a better more thorough cleaning of hotel rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking, private bathroom, and comfy bed.
review.locationRemarks: Near the marina and its major attractions.

review.title: For the price this hotel should have been better
review.reviewText: I feel like I was ripped off with the rate that I paid for this hotel.  I understand there was a big convention in town, but this room should never be more than $125 per night.  other hotels on the same street were advertising last minute rates around $100.  I got punished for booking early.  Expedia is supposed to help with this stuff, that is why I use this service.  I was sold something that I thought was going to be halfway decent, but it was a total dump.  I will think twice before booking another hotel on Expedia that I have not seen before.
review.negativeRemarks: lower the room rate to a reasonable amount, or upgrade the hotel room to match the rate
review.locationRemarks: good shops and restaurants

review.title: GREAT LOCATION!
review.reviewText: Tons of pubs (bars) within walking distance. The staff went ABOVE and beyond to make sure our stay was great, I highly recommend this hotel. :)

review.title: Nice hotel Parking was a pain
review.reviewText: Free parking as long as you don't go out to dinner or leave hotel for any reason
The motel staff are helpful and approachable. Great service

review.title: Decent Place.
review.reviewText: Like others have said, you don't want to park here unless you have a Prius or similar.

review.title: Good location but dingy
review.reviewText: No lifts meant you had to carry bags up three flights of stairs. Rooms were clean but not very big and dark. The hotel needs a good freshen up, it is looking old and tired.

review.title: Better than I expected, would do it again.
review.reviewText: I was trying to get close to the Marina District and stay under $200.  I was a little leery going in as I was traveling with my 8YO daughter.  But everything was nice and the staff was helpful, no attitude like I had read in one review.  Best part was room was quiet and bed was clean and comfy.  It was a nice stay.  Parking spaces are tiny and there are probably half the number of spaces as there are rooms, but we got lucky.

review.title: Hotel slightly better than ok.
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel because it met our three criteria: parking, wifi & breakfast. The lobby area is the breakfast area, with standing room for only two people.  There are no trays to take your food/coffee to room, so take the one from your room.  Breakfast very basic: bread, frozen waffles, bananas, cereal, coffee, juice.  You have to pay for bottle water/pop.  Staff are slow to open and put food out and quick to put away so go early if you want breakfast.  Parking is limited and frustrating because guests cannot seem to park within the lines.  One of us had to guide the other into the stall every time. You also have back out of the parking lot, which is courtyard style, onto Lombard Street. The wifi, though the hotel has 3 guest wifi lines it was always a challenge to logon and remain on for any length of time before you lost the connection - very frustrating when you are using the wifi for map directions in the city.  Lastly the hotel and room: On the third level there is a deck which we found by accident which would have been beautiful had the entire upper corridor not been covered with plastic sheeting and plywood laying on top of it to prevent the plastic from blowing off not to mention the dead plants, old light fixtures and 2x4 lumbers everywhere.  King room was tight:   bed, 1 night stand, 1 arm chair, desk & 1 chair, tv/stand, fridge & microwave.  Bed sagged on one side so we put a pillow under the mattress. Toilet ran continuously.  Bathroom dated, holey towels.
review.positiveRemarks: The young manager was awesome he made you feel welcome, other staff not so much.  If you can live with issues I indicated the location is fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the lumber, plastic sheeting & dead plants; fix up the patio area; new beds, towels, linens; add to menu items upgrade wifi.
review.locationRemarks: The location is about 5-6 blocks to marina and has benches along the paved walk way.  The bus is on the next block, Chestnut. Downtown parking $40/day

review.title: Two day stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
After looking through countless hotel searches I decided to choose the Super 8 based on cost, location, and name. 
This hotel is about a 15 minute bus ride to the Fisherman's Warf and downtown areas of interest.
Bus costs only $2.25 and you get a transfer that is good for about 4 hrs.
Our room was very clean and spacious, however, it was quite noisy as we were on the street side. I would ask for a room off the main street next time.
The staff were very friendly and courteous. Breakfast was your typical carb meal of cereal, bagels, bread, waffles, tea/coffee, yogurt. Enough to get your morning started.
We would definitely stay in this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be nice to have a room where we could take our breakfast as the front lobby is very small and you have to take your meal back up to your room.
review.locationRemarks: Located in a nice area. Nothing sketchy about it. Bus stop is right around the corner. Walgreens right around the corner.

review.title: Quaint hotel close to public transportation.
review.reviewText:
We found the room to be quaint and clean.
There was a lovely terrace on the upper level which was very nice for relaxing in the sun.
We would stay here again if in San Fransisco.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Good price and convenient
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights for trip. The price was nice compare to other hotel. Breakfast was poor and Parking lot is very narrow.
review.locationRemarks: Tour of San Francisco

review.reviewText: Construction was going on and had troubles taking a good nap but overall it was ok

1. on entering the hotel driveway the manager accused me of turning into the driveway too quickly and threatened me that I am not welcome if I didn't slow down. I turned in off of a busy San Francisco street and was barely moving. He claimed to have it on camera but refused to show me. 
He actually said I am NOT WELCOME !!
He also chided me about parking between the white lines prior to me even finishing parking my car. I had to stop because he approached me in the first place. 

2. no tissues in a room costing $160+ & no do not disturb sign

3. extremely noisy construction going on in the hotel 

4. children running around making all sorts of noise outside their rooms

5. house keeping trying to enter my room at 9AM in the morning
review.locationRemarks: A lot of things.

review.title: Unhappiness of staying at the hotel.
review.reviewText: 30 rooms with only 15 or 16 parking spaces with first come first serve purposes.
review.locationRemarks: noneh

review.title: Recently remodeled & super friendly owner
review.reviewText: Room is beautiful & quiet. Recently remodeled handicap room was beautiful! Owner is super friendly. We would stay there again!!!

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: My husband and I had one room and my parents had another room. All four of us agreedt that we would stay there again when we return to San Francisco. The beds were very comfy. The rooms were clean and newly refurbished although the manager said they were waiting for new furniture to be delivered.  Our room were on the front of the building and we didn't have a problem with street noise during the night, although we did keep the fan running on the HVAC unit.  The breakfast was lacking but we had brought things from home anyway so that didn't bother us. You would definitely have to take your food back to your room if you chose to get theirs. The manager was very pleasant and struck up an interesting conversation with my dad about his Korean War days so that made Dad happy.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were soft.  Management was friendly.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco!  Tons of stuff within walking distance.

review.title: Great PLACE on a budget!
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. The property was very clean and well kept, and the rooms were awesome. The beds were super comfortable and plush. AND it was close to UCSF, and right around the corner were lots of restaurants, bars, wine tasting, and shopping. My friend and I were very satisfied with our two night stay. I give this place a 10!
review.negativeRemarks: The parking spots were pretty tight, but the fact that you get free parking is an absolute bonus. Taxis are readily available to take you anywhere.
review.locationRemarks: Ask the folks that run the place, they're very friendly and they will point you in the right direction. Lots of things to do and see.

review.title: Good, but expected better
review.reviewText: hotel was great as well as room, except for the tub i was hopeing to have a jetted tub as i requested and tub was regular, and the room we got was right in front of the street, it did not quiet down until 2am .next time i will request a room toward the back. I would stay their again just in the back

review.title: Very very bad.
review.reviewText: It said free parking, but parking lot on 8 or 10 cars full all time, you should find parking on street in San Francisco! Stuff is unfriendly! First time I faced so horrible servises. Never will come back, %100, I better take a motel 6.
review.locationRemarks: Sorry, I really disapoitent and cant say something good about this.

review.title: Nice Room, Bad Service
review.reviewText: Check in time is at 2pm was not able to check-in until 3:30pm. No explaination given. Reception was not informative about hotel amenities ie; time continental breakfast starts or ends, free wifi. Free parking is very limited, we had to find street parking one night. Maid serve was horrible! Only two positives were that the room was very nice and hotel is close to the Marina District.
great place for the money. location was good for getting around SF

review.title: Nice and comfortable place
review.reviewText: Rooms are little small but comfortable. There is no place to have break fast. So that becomes a little inconvenient. Hotel is in a good location and transport connectivity is good. Three is a 24 hr Walgreen's close by. Overall we had a nice and comfortable stay.

review.title: Overall great, but staff very hot and cold
review.reviewText: Overall the condition of the facilities is pretty nice considering the cost (well, relative to anything else in San Francisco at least); my room was small but very clean, appeared new, and had a comfortable bed and (again) a small but clean bathroom. Location was also great, since there are tourist spots, good restaurants, urgent care/Walgreens (if you find yourself in need) very nearby. However, the folks manning the desk were helpful at times, really rude at others. When I arrived for check-in, they had already left for the night even though it wasn't even 9pm yet and when I called back after finding my key behind a potted plant, they couldn't be bothered about my fridge that was leaking water all over the ground or about my inquiries on how to access the wifi. At other times, the two people running the place were mostly very friendly and helpful. Also, one other strange thing was that we kept on losing power in the early morning (about 4-5 times) even though the buildings across the street still had their lights on, and every time the power comes back on all your lights and the very loud bathroom fan come on, and you have to stumble to the bathroom in a stupor to turn it off, only to repeat the process about half an hour later.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, has a number of nice restaurants and tourist spots nearby, has parking, conditions overall are great
review.negativeRemarks: parking spots better if not diagonal (making getting out difficult), needs more consistent customer service and power supply

review.title: Great Motel for the money!
review.reviewText:
We had stay at a different hotel for 3 night when we realized we were staying one more night in San Francisco. Our hotel didn't have a room for the next night so we ended up going to the Super 8. We were amazed that it was $40 cheaper and the room was nicer.
I would highly recommend this hotel. Parking is included which is a premium in San Francisco.

review.title: Good motel easy access to atractions
review.reviewText: Easy check in. Small but good room. Good restaurants close by.

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: When pulling into the tight parking lot my expectations were low.  The staff I meant was friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable.  I would stay here again and recommend this place.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger parking area would be beneficial but with this being SF that probably is not a possibility.
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants were in walking distance.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Ok hotel, lots of loose fixtures and hairs in sheets. Free coffe put pay bottle water. Noisy. Staff called room at 3:45am by mistake. Won't be back.

review.title: Hotel in San Francisco (California)
review.reviewText: The bedroom was not spacious, but correct and well equiped (micro-wave oven and fridge, and spa in the tub); the breakfast is included (yoghurt, cinnamon rool, bread, waffle, fruits, cereals) - for San Francisco, if you do not want to pay too much for a room, and do not want to pay parking fees, it is a good choice.
review.positiveRemarks: It is of walking distance of different interesting places to see in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: 3 people in the lobby and there is already no room - so definitely the lobby and the sound insulation of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is well situated on Lombard street. You may easily go to the harbour, the cable car departure and the marina.

review.title: Super 8 in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly managers, neat and clean. I was disappointed that although the add said parking was free, it was first come, first serve for parking. We did get a spot, but had to pay $20/night, which was still better than $40/night, which is what other places were charging.

review.title: Room
review.reviewText: Room clean, bed comfortable, location quiet. But parking was terrible

review.title: Hotel staff and parking space
review.reviewText:
We forgot the room key in the room so when we return back to the hotel at night nobody was at the front desk, this happen more than once, a couple of time i need some information or help from the staff and no body was there.

The second problem is the parking space, there are not even one space per room, so if you find a parking space you better take it and dont let it go until checking out
review.locationRemarks: fishermans wharf, fine arts palace, russian hill, lombard street, golden gate, marina district

review.title: Nothing extravagant, but gets the job done
review.reviewText: This is a decent hotel for the price.  The rooms are tiny and you have to get breakfast at the front desk to take back to your room or the patio.  The carpet isn't exceptionally clean (I moved a chair to reveal some corners cut in vacuuming prior to my stay).  There's really nothing to do at the hotel other than watch TV, but its a decent place to sleep in a safe neighborhood.  Also, its pretty far away from some of the main attractions, so be prepared for several $10-$15 cab rides to get back and forth if you don't have a car.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was decent compared to other hotels in the area.  The manager, Rob, was very helpful and nice.
review.locationRemarks: There's some nice restaurants nearby, but all the sightseeing is a cab ride (or a long long walk).

review.title: Location, location,location
review.reviewText:
Owners were very nice and very helpful. Great location with excellent restaurant's and night life a short walking distance away (right around the corner).
Parking spaces are a little limited but in the evening you can park on street for no charge. We only had to do this once. Daytime parking no issue.
review.negativeRemarks: It is an older hotel so for the price it is a great value. If you want modern hotel with pillow top beds, pay twice the price and stay somewhere else.
review.locationRemarks: It is in the Marina District so it is a very desirable neighborhood. Short cab ride to Fisherman's Warf, Bay Bridge and other sightseeing hotspots.

review.title: Nice place to rest your weary self...
review.reviewText: Found this Hotel, and the room was clean, the staff was very friendly.  The only drawback was that I wear a legbrace, and my room was on the3rd floor, and parking was a gamble.  However, the floor location was not a dealbreaker, and the staff helped with parking solutions/suggestions.  It was a very pleasant place to rest my weary self.
review.positiveRemarks: Satillite TV, close to good restaurants, not a lot of traffic noise.  Internet worked great.
review.negativeRemarks: The fridge in the room needed to be defrosted, but other than  that, the facilities were great.
review.locationRemarks: IHOP was a block up the street, and a movie theater was the next block over.  Walgreene's was across the street, and it was easy around.

review.title: Conveniently located to plenty of restaurants
review.reviewText: Great for walking to neighborhood wine bars and restaurants. Be sure to ask for a room away from the street side as it's a bit noisy at 3am.  Otherwise very good place.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great staff, great hotel, I enjoy the stay at super 8

review.title: Perfect place, nice neighborhood
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay late and was the perfect find. Room was comfy, area was safe and had a great sleep. Only downfall was parking was full and had to park on the street (thankfully it was the day you could stay during the night) and then we moved the vehicle early in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is limited by space so really cant say that the parking was their fault
review.locationRemarks: Really close to the marina / bridge

review.title: Great place, great price
review.reviewText: A very nice place within walking distance of the small craft marina and waterfront. My room (one king bed, non-smoking) was a bit small, but very nice. The parking accommodations are also tight, so if you have a large vehicle be forewarned. Overall, I found this to be a great place for a great price.

review.title: Really good place to stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the hot tub bath and food. The bed was soft for us but we slept on the comforter to firm it up a bit. Location was good for what we wanted to do. Free parking was nice but get there early to get a spot and leave the car to keep the spot.

review.title: Good value for cost
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, nice small breakfast. I would stay here again :)
review.positiveRemarks: Location in the Marina and the cost
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge, bay area, Alcatraz, Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to everything - restaurants, bus routes, shopping. It was easy to catch a Muni for a quick ride to the marina. The staff was very accommodating and the room clean. The wi-fi connection was pretty excellent and the tv had dish network. There isn't much to say for the breakfast, but everything else was satisfactory.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, jetted tube, free wi-fi, refrigerator and microwave
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to restaurants, bus routes and shopping. The marina is 25 minute walk or 10 minute Muni ride.

review.title: professionally inappropriate
review.reviewText:
At first I was met with courtesy. However, when friends met me at hotel, and they decided to rent a room as well, the courtesy soon disappeared! one friend has a fully "legal" (paperwork included), service/companion dog, and she (the dog )was denied entry. At which time, the manager called my room and asked inappropriate and
over-personal questions about my friends. plus there was trouble with tv.
review.negativeRemarks: the attitude of management i.e.: genuine respectfulness
review.locationRemarks: hike in woods/explore beaches + yum food

review.title: good place. clean and quiet despite location.
review.reviewText:
good place for the value. clean rooms . perfect bathroom and great location in San Francisco. walking distance of marina and fort mason and golden gate bridge and crissy fields
parking is a bit hard. depending when you get there. only negative thing (and it is not that bad)
would go back there.
review.locationRemarks: golden gate bridge, crispy fields. marina district and downtown SF

review.title: Great location, close to everything
review.reviewText: Quiet, street view and everything was walking distance or a short cab ride away.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Good size room for a budget-minded couple. Free parking is limited so reserve yours early. Good location. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Comp Breakfast is meh.

review.positiveRemarks: The cheap price and the location.
review.locationRemarks: A lot, it's SF!!

review.reviewText: Decent hotel. Limited parking

review.title: Nice little hotel in the city
review.reviewText: Good stay for a few days although a little out of the city centre. Parking said unavailable the first night but once we sorted it with a space in the morning it was fine. Decent all round.

review.title: This is a ideal for visiting a great emplacement
review.reviewText: I like this hotel because is confortable and good deal

review.title: Basic
review.reviewText:
Hotel staff is rude, no courtesy no smile behave like they deal with no human being, they I feel are unhappy themselves. Too expensive for what they provide.
No place to eat in room. Will neve come there again

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Stay away. Very over priced and very rude staff. Worst hotel experience in 25 years!!!!

review.title: Not a good choice for the Bay area
review.reviewText: It's run by an India couple. The wife treated us poorly... I didn't expect a smiling welcome face as family, but she didn't show the basic coustesy in the service industry. The room is tiny; a queen/king bed takes almost all the space. Overall, I was very dispointed.

review.title: Very limited parking on a first in basis only !!
review.reviewText: Nice refurbished rooms. Disappointing that they advertise 'Free Parking' but only have about 12 car spaces whilst they have at least double that many rooms !! Expensive, unsecured street parking and walking long distances to your hotel spoils the experience somewhat !!
review.negativeRemarks: Car parking. Maybe an option to park in a parking station at a reduced 'Hotel Guests' rate instead of expensive street parking

review.title: Disappointing Hotel
review.reviewText: Quite well situated in the Marina district. short bus ride to downtown and other districts. Hotel was small with few facilities. Tiny reception where you get a buffet breakfast and have to take it back to your room as there is nowhere to sit at reception. rooms OK but a bit dingy.
review.negativeRemarks: It just has no facilities or even room for facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Well located

review.title: Very nice hotel ,clean and near to everywhere
review.reviewText: The room was big for two adult and two children age 12 and 16.The room and bathroom were clean
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and quiet but there was not an elevator

review.title: super 8 on Lombard
review.reviewText: No elevator and narrow stairs to 3rd floor room. wifi worked like crap. Volume control on remote didn't work. No safe in the room for valuables. Basically overpriced for this kind of place.
review.positiveRemarks: The clean towels. The location was great but I'll never stay there again.

review.title: go there if you have no other choice
review.reviewText: LOCATION IS GREAT. Room needs upgrade: floors are smelly, bed cover has cigarettes burn spots, mold on the bathroom wall. Price is too much for what it is.
review.locationRemarks: very close to the touristic attractions

review.title: It's OK but such a pain if you have a car
review.reviewText:
Pros:
- Rooms are clean
- Walking distance from vibrant shops, restaurants and night-life
- Public transportation to any part of the city is 1-2 blocks away
- Rooms are cleaned daily and bathroom is spacious

Cons:
- King size rooms are small without any sort of closets
- Rooms are hot and some air conditions don't work well
- Rooms by the street are noisy
- Parking is a huge problem
- Breakfast is a joke
- No elevator

review.title: Nice location...close to wharf and shopping
review.reviewText: We had 2 day go San Francisco cards so after spending the day at six flags in vallejo we drove to the hotel for one night to spend the day in Frisco... the hotel was very accommodating for that... the room was clean and provided a nice place for us to wind down and get ready for the next day. Nice big bathroom and CLEAN!!!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved that it had free parking, wi-fi, and continental breakfast. ...very good pluses for this area!! Truly hard to find all of those together
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing that I would improve would be the mattress...the bed was hard but the extra pillows they gave us helped...but fine for 1 or 2 nights
review.locationRemarks: The location is awesome... close to shopping and restaurants and also just a short drive to the wharf and golden gate park

review.reviewText: For a one night stay it was pleasant and sufficient.

review.title: Barely acceptable
review.reviewText: Barely acceptable. They had not actioned a change of booking made months earlier and tried to evict us a day early despite clear evidence that the extra day had been booked and paid for. The so called Breakfast is located in the lobby a room about 8ft by 6ft with guests constantly coming and going. This is an old property on three stories with narrow stairs and no lift. Without question the worst Super 8 I have stayed in and I have stayed in over 20 in the last 5 years
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing was stolen from the room
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast facility usually good at Super8's and the stairs
review.locationRemarks: Ok but 6 miles from Fishermans wharf

review.title: I would never go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: I must say that the hotel was located in an area where we could drive to places in no time. We were not too thrilled with the area immediately around the hotel. I did not feel safe walking around there. We were also not pleased with the fact that they advertise free parking, which is true, but they do not specify that they do not have parking spots for all their guests! If you do not get a parking spot, you need to park on the street. Their continental breakfast is a joke as they do not have a place to accommodate people who want to eat. If you want to eat, you need to eat while you are standing up. The front desk are is so small that maybe only two people can fit in there....so you better wait for your turn if you want to eat breakfast! We stayed for two nights and do not feel like it was worth the money we paid to stay there. We thought it was too expensive for the kind of room, services and facilities in general.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the fact that the located facilitated us to move around the city very fast.
review.negativeRemarks: They need to really work on having a bigger reception/front desk/breakfast area. They should also not be cooking their food where customers are around
review.locationRemarks: Lombard street is a busy street, so ir almost took us no time to go to other important locations.

review.title: Great location, a block from good food.
review.reviewText: It was the smallest super 8 that we've stayed in, but it was also the most centrally located and had the most character. Throughly enjoyed the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Build a fence around the 3rd floor that allows people to enjoy the view. I'm over six feet tall and was able to enjoy the view, but not my family.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to fisherman's wharf and just a block away from good food.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: Small place, though very well located in terms of getting to places within San Francisco. The breakfast spread was rather cramped - I think most everyone carried their's away to eat in their rooms.....
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and relatively quiet, considering it is on the 101.....
review.locationRemarks: Kept hearing the fog horns from the GG Bridge! Quaint - did not disturb us!

review.title: Very clean & comfortable motel for your family!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay @ the super 8!!! We were impressed with the cleanliness of the room!!! The service we received was outstanding!!! Defiantly reccomend staying at the super 8 motel!!!

review.title: Overall Dissapointed
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was nice at first but when my husband went to inquire about why our TV remote wasn't working the woman at the front desk was rude and rushed. She gave him some instructions that did not work so we ended up not even watching TV. We attempted to watch a movie on our iPad but the internet there wasn't strong enough to stream a movie. The internet the first night wouldn't even hook up.

There was an empty coke liter bottle left in our room which was disgusting that they didn't notice.

There were no cups for coffee in the morning.

The room was musty and smelled like cigarettes.

Overall it was not a pleasant experience and I would definitely not stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The outside looked cool. They had free refreshments in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: See above review of experience. The milk for cereal is left out all morning and not kept cold which I thought was gross.

review.title: Clean, good location, but a bit dumpy.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and in a great spot within Cow Hollow. There was no elevator and the furniture in the room was pretty shabby. The window curtains didn't close either, only the sheer curtains, making privacy a bit light. They provided cabel which was nice. Overall, it was decent. Had the room and bathroom not been so clean, the ratin would have been bit lower.
review.locationRemarks: Good location in Cow Hollow

review.title: Friendly place on Lombard Street
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful reception and staff. Room clean but a bit noisy. Complimentary continental breakfast offered in the tiny reception, but no breakfast room to sit down in. Good location if one doesn't mind walking. Not as close to Fisherman's Wharf as the name might suggest.
review.locationRemarks: Location not as close to Fisherman's Wharf as the hotel name might suggest.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Over 100 rooms and 10 parking spots, when asked regarding parking they stated first come first serve?! Went in my room mattress are so small that the wood board comes out on the sides and its difficult to get out of the bed. The beds are small the restroom had hairs in the floor. The lamps were dusty never been cleaned and run down. At night we had people running up and down the stair way. There was drunk people pounding on door and screaming and crying and no no hotel staff came to take care of it. The only plus is that IHOP Is down the street. The hotel also had old broken furniture in the parking stalls as if those stalls weren't needed for current staying customer. Not worth the money we paid for. Would not recommend nor stay there again.

review.title: It was ok
review.reviewText:
The Hotel was outdated with all decor
The Parking was Bad
It is a 3 story Hotel with No Elevator (hard with luggae and Children)

review.title: Couple's room for the weekend
review.reviewText:
When we first got there, the staff was super friendly.
We were serviced right away and even accommodated us to a parking stop by giving up one of theirs.
The room was very nice, super clean and well decorated.
Our bed was super comfy, amenities were great!
Our experience was awesome and would recommend and stay again anytime!!
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite things about our stay was the decor and the cleanliness of our room. Great bed spread, wall art and awesome bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: parking..not enough parking spaces for all rooms. very cramped!
review.locationRemarks: over all a great location, lots of shops and dining options. 2 miles away from fishermans wharf with buses running until 2am.

review.title: Horrible stay!
review.reviewText: Checked in to the room and was told there was no parking available. When we entered the room, the bed was unmade and empty beer bottles were in the garage. They gave us a new room but it was in remodel stage and the carpets were wet front a overflowing bathtub. The staff was very rude and unapologetic. Stay away!

review.title: March 2013 visit- highly recommend
review.reviewText: Great motel. Only 45 min walk to fisherman's wharf. Breakfast was good. Motel room was quiet from outside traffic noise. Decent food options around and close to laundrymat and shops. Would highly recommend based on price
review.locationRemarks: Set off of street, therefore no Noise at night

review.title: Well done Super 8
review.reviewText:
They were waiting for me and greeted friendly
nd i was lucky to have a parking space for free
MAke long story short it was more than i expected
I sill say thank you Super 8
review.positiveRemarks: It located near high way that i was on and whatever i need as a traveler i could find everything was walking distance
review.locationRemarks: Very good for convenience for traveler

review.title: Will not recommend to anyone
review.reviewText: We travel to San Francisco every year. This year the hotel we typically use was booked so we went with the Super 8 as it stated it was by Fisherman's Wharf. This was not the case. They are closer to the Presidio than the Wharf. The parking was horrible if you have anything other than a compact car. While checking in, the employee that was working the desk was not very friendly or accommodating. We also noticed that the hotel was being renovated as there was work stuff everywhere and there was still blue painting tape up in our room! The TV in the room was hard to operate, and even though we only had it on in the morning while we were getting ready, it still was a pain every time. The only redeeming quality was that the hotel was close to some good restaurants and shops.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable. There were several places to eat and shop close to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is being remodeled and there was 'work and remodel' stuff everywhere. The parking was tight and there was only a few spots.

review.title: Great Lombard Street Locations
review.reviewText: A wonderful location near Pacific Heights, Fisherman's Wharf, and the Golden Gate Bridge. We will stay there again when in SFO. Parking is a challenge in any great city, but we rented two rooms with only one car. When the ongoing renovations are complete there will be two more spaces for parking, which is very secure.

review.title: Better than expected...
review.reviewText: Need a clean, inexpensive room for one or two nights, this place fits the bill well. Staff was pleasant, room was clean, with fridge and microwave, but relatively small. Great location in the Marina district, easy stroll to the Palace of Fine Arts, Presidio, and the bay front trail. Free parking a real plus as the area is well serviced by MUNI.
review.locationRemarks: Easy stroll to the Palace of Fine Arts, Presidio, and the bay front trail.

review.title: A good deal for the price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a good deal for the money. The room was clean. There was on-site parking. The staff accommodated my request for a room away from the street. The facility isn't the best. But it was near where I wanted to be and acceptable in all areas.
review.positiveRemarks: on-site parking and staff willing to accommodate personal requests
review.locationRemarks: good part of SF

review.title: Very good experience
review.reviewText: The location is very good! Very convenient! Close by a lot if stores and restaurants. The room is very clean and so is the bathroom! I only stayed one night but was very pleased. I will definitely stay here again when we come back. Very reasonable and affordable rates!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, fridge, microwave, clean bathroom, flat screen, free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the warf, there is Walgreens, diner, gas station, salon

review.title: Great hotel on the cheap
review.reviewText: The room was very clean. Check-in was easy and quick. The walk to Fisherman's Wharf is a bit far but manageable. Very pleased with my stay especially for the price.

review.title: awsome!
review.reviewText: when first booking this hotel i only booked it because it was last minute and cheap and i was leary about the room i figured it was going to be outdated and dungey but i was completly surorised it was an awsome room newly updated nice and roomy cool window lots of counter space and clean. The staff was really nice and great location lots of things in walking distance starbucks wishermans warf resturants the golden gate. I will deffinatly book this room again on my next stay in san fran!
review.negativeRemarks: parking but we were in early enough to not park on the street so it didnt bother us
review.locationRemarks: awsome and convienient

review.title: reasonable
review.reviewText: Friendly staff but an old building in need of room renovations
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Suprisingly Nice Hotel for the money.
review.reviewText: Looks threw us off. Arrived after midnight and looked dark, and cold but nice young man was at front desk, spoke very good english and got us into the 4 rooms my party had reserved very quickly with out delay (Rooms Prepaid). Inspected rooms and found to be very clean. No residue hair or trash in bathroom. Nice tv and dish network also. Good breakfast in the morning, plenty to eat, fruit, cereal, coffee and juice. Ate both mornings that we stayed and very consistant. A/C worked great and they even let us keep our luggage at the hotel till 3:00 after checkout. Will definately stay her again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, good breakfast, great location and nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Busy street "Lombard" was a little lowd.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText:
it was clean and nice. recommended.
just more parking spots))

review.title: Not worth the money I paid.
review.reviewText: The room was as clean as it could be. It needed updating. The price was high for the quality.
review.locationRemarks: The location is fair.

review.title: Borderline OK
review.reviewText: Clean, but water damage in the bathroom, a lot of paint covering up problems. Fine for one night, but nothing more. Helpful manager and it was quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, right near bus line.

review.title: Good value, great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, comfortable bed, a little noisy but what can you expect in The City? I arrived at 2 pm, checked in snagged a parking spot and walked the neighborhood for the rest of my stay. The fridge, microwave and spa tub were great surprises. Walking distance to Palace of Fine Arts and Marina.

review.title: A Parking Nightmare
review.reviewText: Yes the hotel states that there is "complimentary parking" - when you can find a parking space. The hotel has more rooms than it has spaces. Only they don't mention that. They do point out that there is parking on the street and around the corner. Lombard street is a very busy street and you don't get a very high comfort level if you thnk that your vehicle may get vandalized. And on certain days you have to have your car off the street by 6am for the street cleaners - or you get towed. Other than that the room was clean, and the maid service was consistant. However, I won't be back to that hotel simply because of the parking issue.
review.positiveRemarks: HD TV, Micro, Fridge, alll new

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: basic room, centrally located, restaurants on same street and within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: located near restaurants and transportation muni bus stop was an easy walk-one street over
review.locationRemarks: quiet neighborhood-nearby restaurants & pubs

review.title: Leave the car take the bus.
review.reviewText: Only complaint was car parking was on 1st come basis as parking spaces limited.We had a very enjoyable stay bus stop was around the corner for trips to all tourist attractions we would hope to return sometime in the future. Hotel is in good area with plenty of resturants a short walk from hotel, also complimentry breakfast was pleasant start to our day.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to find, our room very spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: Car parking could be a problem as street parking limited.
review.locationRemarks: Location good, bus to all tourist attractions just around the corner.

review.title: Super 8 give it the gate
review.reviewText: Cigarette burns on the sheets, Weird stains on the bed spread. Other guests making racial comments toward other guests. Guests yelling from the hotel at others parking their cars. Very low end but we paid high end at this location. will never stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Poor location compared to other choices.

review.title: Clean and great location
review.reviewText: Great location - nothing fancy, but clean and staff was friendly

review.title: Mediocre at best!
review.locationRemarks: Not near Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Not very good.
review.reviewText: There was a bug in the bed and when I tried to get someone to change the sheets it took 20 minutes and two requests to get service. Then when the woman went to change the bed she seemed relieved and said "oh, it's only a cockroach" The rest of the room was pretty filthy and reeked of a strong Lysol smell. You can do better than this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: pretty good - on busy Lombard Street but only a quick walk to either Union Street shops or the Marina

review.title: friendly service and good neighborhood
review.reviewText: The manager is also the desk attendant. She was very helpful and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Good neighborhood with many modestly priced cafes, deli and dining opportunities.

review.title: Stayed 05-14-12
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean on the inside (not necessarily on the outside). The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was sufficient. The stairs are steep up to the third floor (however this was mentioned in the hotel information) that there was not an elevator. The parking is super tight and not too many spaces (so definitely first come, first serve.) The breakfast (super small continental) -- coffee, juice, milk, one cereal, pre-purchased pastries. Good for a quick overnight, however not for a long time stay with a family.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: I have stayed at worse in the city
review.reviewText: The price was good for where we were, the only complaint we had was parking. Its one way in, about 8 stalls deep, and nowhere to turn around. Other than that, it was fine, and the lady at the front desk was helpful and witty. There are a couple of nice little deli's on the block behind, and there is an Ihop across the street that we walked to late night.
review.locationRemarks: nice neighborhood to walk around in

review.title: So so
review.reviewText: This motel is very small. Room is small and tight too, Parking lots are limited. 32 rooms and only 15 parking lots (including several only for compact cars). If you plan return after 6pm, you should be prepared to park on the street. Breakfast is complimentary but really really basic, no waffle or eggs. Actually there are lots of motels on Lombard St. with more parking lots and larger rooms, so consider other options.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard St. is good, next to it is Chestnut St. which has a lot of shops and bars including Starbucks.

review.title: San Fransico Trip
review.reviewText: The staff was so helpful with directions, transportation and local shops! I was there for my sons 8th birthday and they made it memoriable! Thanks!!!

review.title: Was alright overall.
review.reviewText: Disappointing in terms of confort, but good enough to have a restful night. Comfy bed + low noise level.

review.title: Clean up
review.reviewText: The beds were as hard as sleeping on the floor, there was big chunks of wood missing from the crown molding, and big issues in the drywall, where you can tell where holes were patched and not painted. The carpet was absolutely disgusting! However the bathroom was descent and clean, as well as the tv,refrigerator, micro-wave, and coffee pot.

review.title: Good value, location, and free parking
review.reviewText: Good value for the price & free parking. We had King bed which was comfortable & clean. Our room had a large window which faced a pleasant looking area across the street. Downside: We were next to Maid's closet so their door keeping opening/shutting, hitting our wall. Packaged Danish, cereal, and coffee for breakfast.

review.title: OK for Quick Stays
review.reviewText: If you stay on second floor (which is actually 1st floor above vehicles), you will hear everyone walking above you and all rooms can hear vehicles starting up so not quiet.

review.title: 49er game
review.reviewText: only problem was with the satellite reciever but the attendants were helpful to get working again
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Great location, good price. we were there for 3 nights but everything was very good

review.title: False advertising
review.reviewText: Definitely not all that close to Fisherman's Wharf. Also, the "free" parking is limited to about twelves spaces. Luckily we were able to find a free spot on the street.

review.title: clean place to stay
review.reviewText: hotel was good for what we needed (a place to stay at the end of the day) only downfall was that we were right on the street so there was a lot of noise, but that is to be expected.

review.title: Surprised.
review.reviewText: The room was a lot nicer than I thought it would be.We had a king bed with a jacuzzi in the bathroom. It was also clean and didn't smell. I was disappointed with the jacuzzi though, especially since they charged extra for it. I thought it would be bigger. I don't know why they say it's at Fisherman's Wharf when it's not. We had to take a 20 minute bus ride when to get to the wharf and our taxi driver was confused when I said it was at the wharf. Continental breakfast was just cereal, drinks and bread.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown, for shopping and the big city feeling. The Castro, go to Hot Cookie Bakery and there's lots of cute little restaurants. Chinatown, for cheap but good food.

review.title: Horrible Place
review.reviewText: This hotel has Bed bugs‚Ä¶.BED BUUUUGS!!. Thanks good that there is a Walgreens close by because I had to get out the room and buy an insect repellant. All my face, arms, and back were itching. I am glad that I had my own pillow, sheet and blanket. The room smells, the parking ...well! What parking are they talking about? Only ten or twelve spaces, that's it, and how many rooms? More than ten so you do the math. Good location, unfortunately old and smelly hotel. The complementary breakfast.......WHAT A JOKE!! I was not expecting lobster but..... some toast and some old pastry come on!! There were like ten people using the toaster I did not get anything I was not that desperate for a piece of bread. I wouldn‚Äôt let my cats stay in that hotel. I DO NOT RECOMENDE. I will rate this hotel half of star.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a very good location. Clean and well furnished rooms. Managers were very friendly, and accommodating. Parking is limited.

review.title: Great Location to Explore San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Do not kid yourself this hotel is in the Marina district and not Fisherman's Wharf. But the cost savings is worth it. Nick and his wife run a great hotel. It is clean and comfortable. They have Dish TV and generous flat screens!

The hotel is close to all the hop-on-hop-off tourist bus stops so it is convenient. The neighborhood has lots of great restaurants on Chestnut and Union Streets.

review.title: Good location, clean rooms, but tiny
review.reviewText:
Lot's of good points with this hotel:
1) Good location for food, entertainment, and public transportation. Chestnut street, right behind Lombard, is hopping with international food, nightlife, and stores of all kinds.
2) Safe location
3) Relatively quite at night.
4) Clean and comfortable beds

Cons:
1) Small rooms, smaller than your average Motel 6
2) Expensive for a small as it is, but that's SF downtown at on season between May-Nov.
3) Parking is limited, but free. Street parking after the lot fills. I staid for 4 nights and got back each night around 7PM and got a place all nights except my last night, and that was because I left and came back after 7PM.

Overall, for the price, I could have gotten the Hilton right across the 80 bridge. The rooms are huge, full service, room service, etc. But if you want to be in the city, that won''t work. It takes about 15 minutes to get across the 80 in off traffic hours
review.locationRemarks: Any area except Tenderloin is fine in San Francisco.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: If you want to be right on Lombard Street near easy access to the City then it was a good hotel for the price. Nothing fancy but clean.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok, location was very good and was clean. The continental breakfast was not located in a very good location. (Where you check in on a small counter & limited options) The parking is interesting, best if you have a compact car & get there early, it's first come first serve with limited space to park.

review.title: Good spot in SF.
review.reviewText: BIg comfy beds, big and clean bathrooms. Will try room service next time.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Right in the middle of everywhere we needed to go.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
Very well located, especially if you take the bus (muni pass is a good deal). 2 bus stops from Golden Gate Bridge, 1 bus stop from the exploratorium, 15 min bus ride from Fisherman's wharf and 30 min from Union Square. Restaurants and shops near by (on Chestnut street mainly). Very safe neighborhood. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was simple : toasts, jam, orange juice and coffee but was enough for us. If I go back to SF I will definitely go back there.
Don't forget to bring a sweater, it's cold there even in summer (13-17C degrees)

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a family vacation to San Francisco and we took our kids with us. Super 8 Hotel was close to where we wanted to be and we were very comfortable in our room. great for the price also.

review.title: Budget Accomodation
review.reviewText:
This is a good hotel. Everything you need for a trip to san francisco. Clean and well furnished. Managers were very friendly, and accommodating. Breakfast is included, fruit and toast, oj and coffee and tea.

Comfortable beds.

Whilst there is parking, it is limited, so be early.

review.title: Great location to the Marina
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, quiet. Great King bed and jacuzzi tub. Awesome location to the Marina in which we needed to be close to the Escape From Alcatraz Triathalon.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: I'm not sure why they call it the Super 8 "Fisherman's Wharf" with it being 10-15 minutes away, depending on traffic. It is close to bus stops and a good location for using the "City Pass" and it's attractions. It is however fairly noisey being right on Lombard St.

review.title: Just what we needed
review.reviewText: When I was looking for a place to stay in San Francisco I was overwhelmed by the multitude of options. Finally I just figured I'd go with the cheaper option since I knew my boyfriend and I had so many things we wanted to do so we'd rarely be in our room anyways. Our plane got in at 10 am and we got to our hotel about 10:45. Check in time wasn't till 2 but we asked the manager at the front desk if we could check in early and he was very accommodating and we were in our room within 20 minutes. The room was nice, like something in a Holiday Inn. The hotel was conveniently located right next to a Walgreens and we were able to walk to most of the attractions and if we couldn't walk there was a bus stop just half a block away. There was some traffic noise but we never had any trouble sleeping. If you're looking for an affordable, nice, well located place to stay I would definitely recommend this Super 8.

review.title: For the price, it was as expected.
review.reviewText:
This hotel does not have all the bells and whistles, but the parking is free. When we were there the owner was replacing many air conditioners, so that is a perk.

The continental breakfast was lame. It was actually laughable. There was coffee, two containers of sugar cereal, and traces of muffins or pastries of a smallish size. No fruits, no juices. Thankfully, we had figured it would be small when we saw the size of the lobby (teeny tiny), and so we planned accordingly. The fridge in the room was nice, and made it convenient to bring leftovers home.

We were able to walk to the wharf, but it was a long walk. Bus lines are everywhere, and the hotel is very helpful with telling you which one to jump on, and where to find it. We were traveling with our 14 month old, and found the area fairly safe to walk around outside at night--this is to and from the wharf from the hotel.

Overall, if you are looking to save money, go ahead and book your nights here.

review.title: It was OK but won't recommend it.
review.reviewText:
They have very limited parking. Although there is street parking, unless you're arriving on Saturday, you have to move your car or pay the meter at 9 AM the other day. The parking is extremely compact and hard to park.

My room is pretty clean and we stayed at the third floor. Our room has the dryer missing and they don't have any (maybe because we checked in late, like 11PM). Although the guy promised to give me one the other day, it never happened.

The guy was not helpful with the TV. He just doesn't like to walk all the stairs up and find that you already have it fixed (our problem is we don't know how to turn on the cable). So make sure you really can't fix it, and after you called, don't try to fix it yourself, in case you really did it, he'll be mad when he's up at your door. The other day we requested an extra bed sheet, and the guy was really helpful. But we have to go down and pick it up ourselves. I guess he really hates walking or walking up stairs.

The stay was ok provided it's one of the cheapest in town.

review.title: Not what was advertised~no where near Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: When I arrived in room the sheets were dirty. This is advertised as "Fisherman's Wharf" but it is in the Marina district and that is not close to the Wharf at all. There was mold everywhere in my room that I did not notice until the next morning because I use a late arrival and the room was so dark. The parking is very limited and one of the reasons the Motels was chosen was because of the free parking.

review.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
review.reviewText: false advertising

review.title: Super 8 = above average 8
review.reviewText:
Clean, quiet room in a great part of town -- near the Marina and Chestnut Street with plenty of bars, shops and restaurants. Nice walk to the Golden Gate Bridge or even to Fisherman's Wharf.

My room felt a bit old -- as in musty, something out of a 1950s roadside motel in the middle of nowhere -- but was clean and quiet. Not much going on in the place, an upstairs patio you could hang out on, but nothing there other than chairs. WiFi for my computer was good and reliable.

But if you need a bed in this fun area of town, no problems here.

review.title: Hotel saved us money so we could enjoy SF more
review.reviewText:
The hotel was easy to find and gracious. It smelled like incense in the lobby as the managers are Indian. I appreciate their quickness, Problems were resolved immediately-a drunk was lost and they came out right a way.
SF has alot of wine avaialble and some adults do not control themselves.
Do not hold this against this hotel.

review.title: not worth it
review.reviewText: Free parking - HOWEVER - spaces are very limited (maybe 10). We got there and the lot was full, had to pay for parking in a nearby lot that charged $15, and the rate went up every few hours. The hotel manager was not helpful about this at all. Room was not numbered; some are, ours was not. Not close to Fisherman's Wharf. Canceled the second two nights, expedia got us a refund. Hotel managers not friendly or helpful, very dismissive. Stay here maybe one night, rooms aren't too bad, just very old-looking/water marks on ceiling.

review.title: okay stay
review.reviewText: Location was good. Room had slight odor. Took care of it with the lysol I brought. Staff was helpful with directions.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Location was fine. Free parking

review.title: Would go back again
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and had everything needed. Hotel is not close to fisherman's wharf but everything can be reached easily by public bus. The Cow's Hollow area has many good places to eat.

review.title: Good value and walkable to waterfront
review.reviewText: This is a good value for a clean hotel within walking distance to the waterfront (if you're a walker). No immediately close restaurants that I noticed. At check-in a problem with smoky room was quickly resolved. Rooms were accessible by steep stairs, which could be a problem for some guests. Included breakfast was sweet rolls, cereal, juice, coffee--ran out of orange juice by 9am.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: Everything was very good and we would be very happy to stay there again.

review.title: Pretty good if you don't need to park
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel for the night before Halloween. The parking lot is tiny and there is only one exit, which makes finding parking on a busy night difficult and makes getting back out dangerous and/or difficult.

The woman at the front desk was friendly and gave me good directions when I asked. The room was nice and had a big screen TV, although I didn't have time to see what was available on it.

I was pleased with everything until I tried to get back out of the parking lot in the morning.

review.title: great
review.reviewText: Best value. excelent location

review.title: Was worth the money
review.reviewText: Our stay was really nice. The room was small but surprisely comfortable. The staff was nice and helpful. The only thing that was crazy was the parking! Very few parking spots for the number of rooms otherwise it was fine.

review.title: Not worth the savings, bad experience.
review.reviewText: Not worth the savings. No towels in room upon arrival and had to wait each day for them to be washed. Keys would expire every night and had to get new ones with unfriendly, unhelpful staff, friend got locked out in middle of night while I was sleeping.

review.title: Room was nice, but parking was a nightmare!
review.reviewText: Over all the hotel was clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was made up of bitter coffee and stale cold cereal. The parking situation was just terrible. The hotel's lot is very small. When we arrived there was a car parked across two parking spaces. I spoke with the hotel manager about it and he said he would call the room of the person who owned the car. Nothing happened. Later it became clear that the car belonged to the manager, and in fact many of the spaces for guest parking were taken up by hotel employees. Bad business if you ask me. Would not stay there again because of this

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: We were mislead by the name of the hotel. It was not even close to Fisherman's Wharf! We checked in,they tried to put all 4 adults in 1 room with a queen size bed..we had reservations for 2 rooms for 4 adults. They took an additional 50 bucks on the credit card to insure they would get their money if we used to phone etc. one room had a phone that did not work. Once you are in the service was not good.

review.title: Fine accommodations at a great price
review.reviewText: Nice to have parking. Room was clean and adequate. A little disappointed in the location, since the tile of the hotel lead me to think it was by the Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Quiet and Great Location in the Marina District
review.reviewText: Room was surprisingly quiet for location. Very close to Palace of Fine Arts and short bus ride to Fisherman's Wharf. Free WiFi. Great price. Recommend.

review.title: San Francisco Super 8
review.reviewText: The hotel was quite clean, however the owners seemed preoccupied with their family. My room did not have an ice bucket, which is something I wanted in San Francisco in the middle of May when it was about 80-90 degree weather. I told them about this, and they said they would bring me one. Two days later when I checked out, I still did not have an ice bucket. Other than that, it was a good stay.

review.title: very nice owners
review.reviewText: clean, close to many sights. owner/managers were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Deceptive location
review.reviewText: I was a little disappointed that for being called "Fishermans Wharf" we couldn't have been much further from the wharf.

review.title: Just fine!
review.reviewText: We were here on a weekend exploring trip on a budget and this place seemed like it would suit our needs. There was nothing remarkable about this hotel. It was fairly clean, it had internet, parking and english muffins in the morning. It was walking distance to some stores and restaurants. There is a Himalayan place next door that has good Momos . (like and indian food dumpling, soooo good, but that is a different review) The bus lines go by this place as well making it easy to leave your car and get around. My only real complaint was crappy water pressure in the shower. There are a lot of other budget hotels in the area and I probably would come back to this one.

review.title: so/so
review.reviewText: this hotel was so/so at best. it is nowhere near the fishermans wharf, but thankfully the 30 bus route is nearby on chesnut st, to get you to most tourist attractions and runs frquently. the hotel staff was lukewarm at best and not very helpful. location was in close proximity to shops and bars, coffee shops, etc. i expected a little better for the price

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The service was rude. Instead of the double room I requested, I was given a king bed and a roll away that hardly fit in the room. The parking lot was too small for the number of rooms, leaving people to have to park on the streets in San Francisco in a neighborhood that I wouldn't consider the safest.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The experience was terrible. The entire third floor had been booked to a group of young men who proceeded to go out drinking and run up and down the halls yelling and screaming all night.
